entry.title: 2024 AMC 10A
entry.content:
I did not underperform, itâ€™s just my skill issue.

Still not much to say really, still sad

Score: 716 (333 / 50 / 333 distrib)

I feel that Iâ€™m probably not promoting tbh

Basically I looked at all three problems first then figured that p3 seems to be pretty well known and I mightâ€™ve even solved it before. Then I spent like 40 minutes on trying some random greedy that did not work. Then I decided to go look at the other problems.

First p1. I looked at the subtasks and thought that it could do with sqrt and wrote some kind of Nsqrt(N)log^2(N)-ish solution (I thought that thereâ€™s only one log because I suck at time complexity, which was also why I decided to implement it). It only failed three testcases. I moved on because three testcases didnâ€™t really seem to matter right now.

This was about at the 1 hour mark since I passed (most of) p1 relatively quickly. Then I looked at p2 and had no idea. I thought of dp for subtask 2 but nothing beyond that. I decided that â€œp3 must actually be very easyâ€ and put 2 more additional hours on that problem. I just started having random ideas and found out that greedy actually worked. Itâ€™s a rather short implementation so I ACed the problem at around the 3 hour mark.

At this time my score was about 600, and I figured that the 3 testcases might actually matter. (At this point I still didnâ€™t notice that my time complexity had two logs) I thought that it mustâ€™ve been a constant problem, so I removed the â€œdefine int long longâ€ and other unnecessary code to pass all testcases.

I had 666 points, and since p1 and p3 seemed to be relatively easy (although I had a skill issue and spent 3 hours on them), I thought the cutoff would be around 800. This also meant that I would have to solve subtask 3 in the remaining hour. This didnâ€™t seem too bad, but I thought I should solve subtasks 1 and 2 first to secure a score above 700. Then, since I had a significant skill issue I spent about 30 minutes to solve those subtasks after I had the idea for dp (the main thing was that my solution was different and implementation heavy I guess).

Then I just spent the remaining 30 minutes thinking about how to solve subtask 3 and not solving it (which is essentially doing nothing)

After the contest, people seem to say that the cutoff will be around 750. I hope that the cutoff is 700, although it seems realistically impossible ngl.

Still hope that the cutoff is 700 (or lower) ğŸ¥º I still want a chance to camp in 9th grade, even if itâ€™s 0.000000001%

I also learned that Iâ€™m not the only CF master clowning in USACO gold
entry.summary: I did not underperform, itâ€™s just my skill issue.

entry.title: Mid December Update
entry.content:
found that I havenâ€™t posted for a long time, although thereâ€™s probably like only one person reading this (myself)

Oh well there isnâ€™t much to say so I guess I wonâ€™t make any subtitles

Basically I did get DHR in 10A (and did not in 10B), which is probably the only thing Iâ€™m happy about recently. Totally threw in BMT, and I donâ€™t seem prepared myself for USACO. I also might be cooked in Literature ğŸ’€

And NHSPC (a Taiwanese contest for high schoolers, problems can be found here) also happened recently, @the_researching_pooh @69manweiwei @leolin orz

Finally, hopefully I get lucky enough tomorrow and advance into Platinum :) I donâ€™t know why but advancing really seems so hard and impossible to me, I canâ€™t even AK when I look at past problems now. And LMT is also happening tomorrow, but because it clashes with USACO certified period Iâ€™m not going, sad
entry.summary: found that I havenâ€™t posted for a long time, although thereâ€™s probably like only one person reading this (myself)

entry.title: Quarter 1 Recap
entry.content:
writing now although quarter 1 ended on 11/8

Social

Alright seems that the â€œnot socializing with homeroom peopleâ€ strategy is not working out smh

I donâ€™t know whether this is normal but I only have one person in my homeroom I share science with, and zero in all other classes (excluding PE). I also barely share studies with people in my homeroom.

Another thing is that our male-female ratio is like 1:2, and Iâ€™m not the type of person that talks with girls a lot, which makes things even worse.

Other classes are much better though than homeroom imo, at least I talk to people.

CP

I didnâ€™t really do CP a lot this quarter, I guess I will fall back to specialist on CF soon.

I havenâ€™t really done any contests recently after I reached master, maybe just one AtCoder contest and an HSCSA contest. I feel I should practice more OI though, I havenâ€™t practiced a lot and will probably throw OI contests for not getting any partials.

Also LIT is currently indefinitely postponed, so I might fail my C1 goal miserably ğŸ¤¡ Hopefully it will eventually happen, although I might still not get first in middle school division because Iâ€™m bad.

Academics

Not too bad I guess.

In the beginning my grades were bad for Earth Science but it went back up later after all the tests and other stuff. On the contrary, my humanities (Literature + Social Studies) grades gradually dropped as the quarter passed. At least I successfully kept my GPA above 4.

Current GPA: 4.13, might still change though since grades are not final until like 11/18. Iâ€™m pretty glad that my teachers arenâ€™t too harsh on grading.

Math

I feel thereâ€™s much more math contests here, and math team people are very orz.

A good thing about LHS I guess is that thereâ€™s a lot of orz people and I can learn from them instead of having to do everything myself. Also that I can be carried in contests like HMMT which feels very nice.

The tryouts went out nicely for me, at least I didnâ€™t silly too much, which placed me in teams that may be higher than my capability. Iâ€™ll try my best not to do nothing I guess.

I originally thought that math team had meetings too often, but because of the half days and all the breaks it turns out not to be that many.

And I kind of stopped doing OTIS after school started which is bad, Iâ€™ve completed 2 units after the summer break and only 2 units after school started. Iâ€™m currently like level 31 and I donâ€™t know how good that is.

btw Iâ€™m not trying to say anything is a scam or something

entry.title: HMMT
entry.content:
yayy

Iâ€™m in Lex Gamma, and Iâ€™m probably the only person in the team (or maybe among everyone in LHS that came to HMMT this year) that has never competed in HMMT. Everyone in the team is way better than me tho, so Iâ€™m ready to be carried in team and guts round and drag the team down in individual rounds.

General Round

I did problems 1-6 and 8 and didnâ€™t even look at the other problems. They announced the answers right after the test ended and I got 3 and 6 wrong which is like sad. I felt soo good when I remembered about the â€œ15â€ case for problem 6 and thought that many people would probably forget about that one, but turned out that I forgot about the 195 case so I was like one off. I wouldnâ€™t call that a silly though, as itâ€™s my own skill issue, but I probably lost like 6 points because of this. At least I found the right pattern in problem 8 which is not too bad.

Theme Round

0 sillies in this round, but still bad

I only looked at 1-7, and 9 (because itâ€™s combo) and didnâ€™t know how to do 6 because Iâ€™m bad at geo. Turned out I spent too much time on 9, and didnâ€™t really do it the right way. Although I solved 6 problems my distrib is like very bad, so Iâ€™m probably the lowest in the team.

Team Round

tnag carry orz

I probably didnâ€™t do anything, except p1 p4 and maybe p8, which other teammates could probably have done quickly without me. We (tnag) also perfed teamround with like 5 or 10 minutes left which was nice. We ended up turning it in 30 seconds early maybe for bragging purposes, idk

And they posted the solutions on the HMMT website immediately after the teamround ended, and we ended up not sillying anything and getting a perfect score, tnag orz

Guts Round

alright this is when I really did absolutely nothing

We started pretty good in the first seven sets (perfect score on each), but we were a bit slow so we had to rush through the rest of the sets and unfortunately got 0 points in estimation. Still rank 10 which is like good compared to our scores in individual rounds lol.

Other

tnag went to int bee finals, tnag orz

I also went to both Friday night and the Sunday lectures because itâ€™s my first time. On Friday I went to HackHMMT and unexpectedly met CorzdeTiger and Sunday stuff were interesting I guess?

Estimates

G 21.153, T 23.242, Total 44.395
G rk. 60, T rk. 60, Total rk. 70
I sold so bad :(
Letâ€™s see how good an estimate of my score this is. I probably failed the M2 goal miserably

Aftermath

I turned out to be not too bad at predicting?

Results:
G 20.153, T 24.242, Total 44.395
G rk. 89, T rk. 44, Total rk. 65

Kinda happy that I did have something in top 50 but also kinda sad for being that close to top 50 in general and overall (well itâ€™s not actually that close, but I just felt I was so dumb for forgetting about the 195 case)

At least Iâ€™ve finally achieved one of my goals.

entry.title: 2024 AMC 10A
entry.content:
oops, although I guess itâ€™s not too bad (LONG RANT WARNING)

Before

I was like kinda nervous, because even though this wasnâ€™t my first time taking the AMCs (actually 10th time), itâ€™s the first time Iâ€™m taking it digitally, and Iâ€™m afraid that I would mess up. I probably had to be extra careful as I thought itâ€™s easier to misclick something and ruin my entire test.

Last time I wasnâ€™t rlly satisfied with my score (120 on an extremely easy test), so I donâ€™t want to have bad time management again. I also hope that my AMC10 scores wonâ€™t be like my AMC8 ones (strictly decreasing arithmetic sequence). I sillied so bad in the past (4 sillies on AMC8 after reviewing my answers !!!)

The test (?)

So although I was a bit nervous, I tried to tell myself to stay calm, that thereâ€™s always a 10B and I had little chances to get into JMO anyway. Still, I didnâ€™t expect the Commons I (where we took the AMC10 in LHS) to be that crowded, which somehow made me even more anxious.

I originally wanted to use some kind of strategy like starting from the middle so that I would feel more confident, but then thought that would be worse as I might not even be able to solve those problems :(

I spent like 2 minutes solving p1 because I was so afraid I might silly the first problem. Then I looked at p2, and this was when all the disaster started.

I stared at the problem for 1 minute, trying to understand it, and finally understood it. But I was afraid that I would silly on the second problem, so I subtracted the two from each other and was stuck because I thought 300 / 0.3 = 100 ğŸ’€

Then I was stuck for another 5 minutes

I decided that I shouldnâ€™t be stuck on a problem for too long, so I moved on. But after doing every 5 problems, I was like â€œitâ€™s impossible that p2 was so hardâ€ and went back to get stuck for another 3 minutes. I felt so desperate when I couldnâ€™t even do problem 2 when I was aiming for DHR, and couldnâ€™t stay calm even though I tried to, until I found out that I solved 16 problems and there was 15 minutes left.

I briefly counted and found that I could only get a 109.5 (without any sillies), and I might really get a lower score than last year. Based on past experiences, I on average had 3 sillies per AMC, so I might not even make AIME ğŸ’€

I expected myself to panick even more after realizing this, but perhaps itâ€™s that the problems later were easier, I did 18-22 pretty quickly, and also found my mistake in p2. In the last few minutes, I knew that I didnâ€™t really have time to check my answers, so I only made sure that I didnâ€™t click on the wrong option on the computer.

After

I didnâ€™t really check my answers with others since the digital version scrambled the questions and answer choices so that itâ€™s harder to cheat (and I didnâ€™t notice for a while). I knew I probably got a really bad score, considering that I could easily calculate wrong when Iâ€™m nervous. Anyways thereâ€™s still a B so hopefully I get a better score on that one :<

===== Above was written before I knew the answers (and scores) =====

So turns out that I didnâ€™t have any sillies, giving me a 136.5 (18 higher than expected). Itâ€™s still not a very good score considering people saying that this yearâ€™s test was also easy like last year, but enough to make me happy I guess. This is probably my first AMC without sillies, which is ironic as people on AoPS said that this was the most silliable test ever.

My distrib: 11111 11111 11111 11111 11bbb

By this time Iâ€™ve also finished taking 10B but I probably wonâ€™t write a blog about it because Iâ€™m lazy and I did very bad despite itâ€™s much easier than 10A imo.

Hopefully 136.5 is enough to get DHR, MAA didnâ€™t release the statistics this time so I dont really know, sad.
entry.summary: oops, although I guess itâ€™s not too bad (LONG RANT WARNING)

entry.title: Goals for 24-25 School Year
entry.content:
Seems a bit too late, but whatever

Many people had been posting about their goals for the school year, so I guess Iâ€™ll make one too? So here are my goals, the goals in each category are rougly sorted by difficulty

Legend:

  • âœ” = successful
  • ğŸ“ˆ = currently successful
  • â“ = nothing yet
  • ğŸ“‰ currently failing
  • âŒ = already failed

CP (C)

  • First Place in LIT Standard Round MS Division â“
  • CF maintain stable 2100+ by end of year ğŸ“ˆ
  • AtCoder 1900+ ğŸ“‰
  • CF Peak IM ğŸ“‰

USACO (U)

  • Plat â“
  • Plat by december â“
  • Get a positive score on each USACO plat contest â“
  • Camp â“

Math (M)

  • AMC 10 DHR âœ”
  • Get individual top 50 in something in HMMT November âœ”
  • Reach level 50 in OTIS ğŸ“‰
  • JMO qual â“

Other (O)

  • Top 500 on CF contribution leaderboard ğŸ“‰
  • GPA 4.0+ ğŸ“ˆ
  • Stop being lazy ğŸ“‰
  • Socialize ğŸ“‰

Difficulty order (in my opinion)

C1 < U1 < M1 < C2 < O1 < U2 < M2 < O2 < M3 < U3 < C3 < C4 < M4 < O3 < U4 < O4

Iâ€™m new here so idk what math contests they have and their difficulty rlly

Also Iâ€™m known for being bad at estimating difficulties of goals (I thought getting into USACO plat was way easier than reaching master on CF ğŸ˜­)

Hopefully I can complete maybe 10 of the goals, tho everything above C4 seems impossible to me and Iâ€™m very good at sillying and being dumb
entry.summary: Seems a bit too late, but whatever
